metadata.synopsis: Shadowheart confides in the player during the third night that they stop to camp. The expected effects of their tadpole condition have not come to pass, and Shadowheart tries to reason what this might mean. Are they out of the woods, or is this still just the start of something much worse? Hope and disquiet in equal parts.

23.speaker: Shadowheart
23.text: The leader of the pack comes to chat.

59.speaker: Shadowheart
59.text: What's on your mind? You must be pleased to have a clear path forward.

35.speaker: Shadowheart
35.text: Finally, some good fortune. Come morning, we know what to do.

64.speaker: Shadowheart
64.text: The sooner we find the druid Halsin, the better. I can't wait to get rid of this thing in my head.

57.speaker: Shadowheart
57.text: The sooner we find this 'Priestess Gut', the better. I can't wait to get rid of this thing in my head.

54.speaker: Shadowheart
54.text: I can't wait to get this thing out of my head.

83.speaker: Player
83.text: So what will come next for you, once this is all over?

67.speaker: Shadowheart
67.text: Head to Baldur's Gate. Someone's waiting for me.

45.speaker: Shadowheart
45.text: Let a girl have some secrets. Was there anything else?

58.speaker: Player
58.text: Use your shared connection. Probe her thoughts.

26.speaker: Narrator
26.text: *You find a current of hope flowing through her thoughts. She believes you all have a real chance.*

90.speaker: Narrator
90.text: *She's anxious to find this person in Baldur's Gate. Whoever it is has a strong hold over her, and can give her something she desperately wants...*

87.speaker: Player
87.text: This person in Baldur's Gate must be very important to you.

50.speaker: Shadowheart
50.text: Yes, vastly so. But I don't want to talk about her. Not right now.

15.speaker: Shadowheart
15.text: It's a beautiful night. I think I'll stay up to enjoy it while I still can. Rest well.

2.speaker: Shadowheart
2.text: We should get some rest. Good night.

51.speaker: Shadowheart
51.text: The same. These parasites are proving suspiciously benign.

61.speaker: Shadowheart
61.text: But suppose I turn... what would you do?

40.speaker: Player
40.text: Maybe I could leave you tied up while I hunted for a cure.

95.speaker: Shadowheart
95.text: Anyway, get some rest. Try not to dream about tying me up.

62.speaker: Player
62.text: No hesitations. I'd just end your misery, then and there.

5.speaker: Shadowheart
5.text: Wise... though I hope you'd miss me after I'm gone. I think I would, if the positions were reversed.
5.context: InternalNodeContext: This node only plays if SH approves of the player for 10 or moreNodeContext: Approving of player's practical answer. Hint of affection towards them also.

14.speaker: Shadowheart
14.text: But you're right - if we're to make it through all this, there can be no room for hesitation. You're doing well.

78.speaker: Shadowheart
78.text: A firm answer. I'd do the same.

43.speaker: Shadowheart
43.text: We'll need that kind of thinking to make it through all this. You're doing well.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: Let's not do this. I don't like hypothetical questions.

86.speaker: Shadowheart
86.text: It's hardly hypothetical - we're still in danger, after all.

74.speaker: Player
74.text: If you turned into a monster? I'd run away.

29.speaker: Shadowheart
29.text: Hah! And I'd chase you as fast as my tentacles could carry me.

16.speaker: Shadowheart
16.text: It's a beautiful night. I think I'll stay up to enjoy it while I still can. Rest well.
16.context: CinematicNodeContext: Glancing up at the night sky.

76.speaker: Shadowheart
76.text: We should get some rest. Good night.

79.speaker: Player
79.text: You know, this could be our last night together.

37.speaker: Shadowheart
37.text: I hadn't thought of that. What do you have in mind?

84.speaker: Player
84.text: We could find somewhere discreet right now... away from the camp.

94.speaker: Shadowheart
94.text: Hmmm... Brambles on bare skin aren't as fun in practice, I'm afraid.

77.speaker: Shadowheart
77.text: Perhaps we should wait for more comfortable surrounds.

36.speaker: Shadowheart
36.text: Besides, I can't afford to tire you out - we still have work to do. Rest well.

52.speaker: Player
52.text: Probably wise to just get some rest.

11.speaker: Player
11.text: How about a few songs around the fire with the others?

7.speaker: Shadowheart
7.text: Ah... that sounds... interesting. But on second thought, I'm quite tired.

30.speaker: Shadowheart
30.text: Perhaps something else will come to you, before we part ways. Rest well.

55.speaker: Player
55.text: Is she serious? Probe her thoughts using your shared connection.

25.speaker: Narrator
25.text: *She is serious. Even she seems surprised. She's attracted to you...*

73.speaker: Narrator
73.text: *... but you sense more - a warm swell of embarrassment.*

48.speaker: Player
48.text: Once this is all over, we should find a tavern and celebrate properly.

88.speaker: Shadowheart
88.text: Heh. A little comfort and company doesn't sound bad...

66.speaker: Shadowheart
66.text: ...but let's take care of our problem first. Rest well.

42.speaker: Shadowheart
42.context: NodeContext: Sharp anger. The player stepped over a boundary (tried to read her thoughts).

89.speaker: Shadowheart
89.context: NodeContext: Cursed thing = tadpole. Player's attempted mindmeld caused her some discomfort.

17.speaker: Shadowheart
17.text: Do that again, and I'll split your skull, understand?

6.speaker: Player
6.text: I just want to know how you really feel.

21.speaker: Shadowheart
21.text: If I want you to know something, I'll tell you.

33.speaker: Player
33.text: Do what again? What are you talking about?

3.speaker: Shadowheart
3.text: Keep this up, and I'm out of here.

72.speaker: Player
72.text: I had to be sure I could still trust you.

4.speaker: Shadowheart
4.text: Hmmm... you'd do well where I'm from. But don't try it again.

49.speaker: Shadowheart
49.text: Now go rest. And keep your mind to yourself.

82.speaker: Shadowheart
82.text: At least you're honest. Don't do that again.

85.speaker: Shadowheart
85.text: Stop! I already warned you not to do that again.

68.speaker: Shadowheart
68.text: I can't trust you, can I?

46.speaker: Shadowheart
46.text: The sooner we part ways, the better. Until then, keep away from me.

9.speaker: Shadowheart
9.text: I hope not. I'd miss our little conversations... wouldn't you miss them as well?

38.speaker: Player
38.text: I have enjoyed your company, yes.

13.speaker: Shadowheart
13.text: I'm glad. Hopefully we can eke out some more time together, before all's done and dusted...

0.speaker: Player
0.text: We're just working towards a common goal. Don't get sentimental.

96.speaker: Shadowheart
96.text: That's not something I'm accused of very often... but I suppose you're right. I'll let you get your rest - good night.
96.context: NodeContext: A little surprised, but she can't fault the player's lack of sentiment.

60.speaker: Player
60.text: No. I just want to put all this behind me.

20.speaker: Shadowheart
20.text: Oh. In that case, I won't keep you from your blanket. The time in my company will pass more quickly if you're asleep. Good night.
20.context: NodeContext: A little wounded and frosty.

31.speaker: Player
31.text: Journey's not over yet. We should both get some rest.
